revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2018}} The '''Ahsani family''' are a prominent [[Monaco]]-based business family of [[Iran]]ian origin. The family is headed by Ata Ahsani. Ata and his two sons Cyrus and Saman run the energy industry consultancy [[Unaoil]]; his third son, Sassan, heads the British property company Lumina Real Estate Capital.
The Aria Trust is the [[Discretionary trust|family trust]] of the Ahsani family. In 2007 the trust held €63 million in bank accounts and private equity with its international property holdings in Monaco, [[France]], the [[United States]] and [[London]] having an estimated value of €130 million.<ref name=MelAgeWho>{{cite news|url=http://www.theage.com.au/interactive/2016/the-bribe-factory/day-1/who-are-the-ahsanis.html|title=The Bribe Factory: Who are the Ahsanis?|date=30 March 2016|work=The Melbourne Age|accessdate=30 March 2016}}</ref><ref name=MelAgeCompany>{{cite news|url=http://www.theage.com.au/interactive/2016/the-bribe-factory/day-1/the-company-that-bribed-the-world.html|title=The Bribe Factory: Part 1|date=30 March 2016|work=The Melbourne Age|accessdate=30 March 2016}}</ref> The Ahsani family have a charitable organisation, Unakids. The Ahsani family control [[shell company|shell companies]] in the tax havens of the [[Channel Islands]], the [[Marshall Islands]], and the [[British Virgin Islands]], through which Unaoil's business is conducted. In March 2016 ''[[The Age]]'' described Unaoil as "the unseen intermediary in massive deals between the world's biggest energy companies and notoriously corrupt governments in the Middle East, Eastern Europe and Africa."<ref name=MelAgeWho/> The family’s portfolio of real estate includes German nursing homes, and properties in multiple countries.<ref name=MelAgeWho/>
==Family members== Ata Ahsani was born in 1940 in [[Kerman]], Iran, and later studied engineering in England and the United States before working for an oil company in Iran. Ata Ahsani left Iran for the United Kingdom in the wake of the 1979 [[Iranian Revolution]], and established Unaoil in 1990.<ref name=MelAgeWho/>
Cyrus Ahsani is Ata Ahsani’s oldest son. He is the treasurer of Monaco's Ambassador's Club, the club is headed by [[Albert II, Prince of Monaco|Prince Albert II of Monaco]].
Saman Ahsani was born in December 1973.<ref name="Companies House">{{cite web|title=Brokerbox Ltd|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/03995070/officers|website=Companies House|accessdate=30 March 2016}}</ref> He is chairman of the [[Iran Heritage Foundation]], and has established a new Patron’s Circle in this role.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Curtis|first1=John E.|title=Chief Executive’s Review - Year Ending 31st December 2015|url=http://www.iranheritage.org/ceo-review.html|website=Iranheritage.org|accessdate=15 February 2017}}</ref> Ata Ahsani's third son, Sassan Ahsani (born January 1978),<ref name="Companies House 2">{{cite web|title=Lumina Real Estate Capital Limited|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/05895433/officers|website=Companies House|accessdate=30 March 2016}}</ref> is based in London and is the head of Lumina Real Estate Capital, a property investment company. Ata Ahsani was a shareholder in Lumina between 2012 and 2016.<ref>{{cite web|title=LUMINA REAL ESTATE CAPITAL LIMITED|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/05895433/officers|website=CompaniesHouse.gov.uk|accessdate=15 February 2017}}</ref>
==Description== Hundreds of thousands of emails sent within Unaoil and between members of the Ahsani family from 2001 to 2012 were leaked to investigative journalists and formed the basis for a series of stories in [[Fairfax Media]]'s ''[[The Age]]'' newspaper and the ''[[Huffington Post]]'' in March 2016. ''The Age'' described Cyrus as "...in charge of day to day operations, though he often defers to his father for big decisions and important interactions" and described his character as "intelligent and good humoured: a man who inspires loyalty".<ref name=MelAgeWho/>

{{Infobox officeholder | name = Cherif Guellal | image = Cherif guellal identité.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = | office = [[Algerian Ambassador to the United States]] | term = 1963 – 1967 | predecessor = Created | successor = Abolished | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date|1932|08|19}} | birth_place = [[Constantine, Algeria]] | death_date = {{death date|2009|04|7}} | death_place = [[Algiers]] | residence = [[Georgetown (Washington, D.C.)]] | nationality = Algerian-American | ethnicity = | education = [[Aix-en-Provence]] | occupation = Diplomat | signature = Signature de Cherif Guellal.svg | signature_alt = Signature of Cherif Guellal |partner = [[Yolande Fox]] }}
'''Cherif Guellal''' (born 19 August 1932 in [[Constantine, Algeria]] – deceased 7 April 2009)<ref name=LATObit>{{cite news|title=Cherif Guellal dies at 76; Algerian resistance fighter and diplomat|first=Adam|last=Bernstein|date=April 13, 2009|accessdate=April 13, 2009|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|url=http://www.latimes.com/news/obituaries/la-me-cherif-guellal13-2009apr13,0,5184367.story}}</ref> was an [[Algeria]]n businessman and [[diplomat]], who fought in the [[Algerian War|Algerian independence movement]] and who was a citizen of the [[United States]].
==Biography== Cherif Guellal attended the university at [[Aix-en-Provence]] in southern [[France]], and graduated in 1956. Taking the lead from his mother, who was a leader in the [[Algeria]]n anti-French [[Nationalism and resistance in Algeria|resistance movement]], he joined the [[government in exile]]. He worked to build support for the movement, mainly from [[India]].
He served as a key aide to the resistance leader [[Ahmed Ben Bella]], who became the first [[President of Algeria|president of post-colonial Algeria]]. He was sent to [[Washington, D.C.]], as the new country's first [[Ambassador]] to the [[United States of America|United States]]. His primary role was to protect the Algerian oil interests and handle the independence of Algeria in the cold-war era.<ref>Mohammed Lakhdar Ghettas, [https://books.google.com/books?id=hppNDwAAQBAJ Algeria and the Cold War: International Relations and the Struggle for Autonomy], ''IB Tauris'', 24 November 2017 ({{ISBN|9781786722591}})</ref> The US-Algeria relations were also tensed by the establishment of the Vietcongs' first mission outside of Vietnam, in Algeria.<ref>Richard B. Stolley, [https://books.google.com/books?id=7VUEAAAAMBAJ Hertz's unfinished bike race], ''Ĺife Magazine'', 21 July 1967</ref> Cherif Guellal also had to handle Algeria's official ties with Cuba and the tension it generated within the US diplomatic corps.<ref>Federico Vélez, [https://books.google.com/books?id=bT4lDwAAQBAJ Latin American Revolutionaries and the Arab World: From the Suez Canal to the Arab Spring], ''Taylor & Francis'', 15 May 2017 ({{ISBN|9781134804535}})</ref> In a 1964 speech, he stated «We wish to be masters in our own house and not junior partners of the great powers».<ref name=LATObit/>
In May 1964, after [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] was named to the White House, his 12-room French chateau-style house (''The Elms'') was sold to the Algerian government and became the residence of Cherif Guellal.<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/1964/05/09/archives/johnson-house-is-bought-for-algerian-ambassador.html Johnson House Is Bought For Algerian Ambassador], ''Nytimes.com'', 9 May 1964</ref> According to the writer [[Barbara Howar]] in her 1973 memoir ''Laughing All The Way'', Guellal and Johnson both originated from oil-rich states ([[Texas]] for Johnson) and shared a similar mentality towards politics.<ref name=LATObit/>
He outlasted his mentor, remaining in his post following the [[military coup]] that removed Ben Bella from power and installed [[Houari Boumedienne]], the former [[National Liberation Front (Algeria)|National Liberation Front]] military chief, in his place.
In Washington, he successfully lobbied for the repeal of racially restrictive covenants on his ambassadorial residence, one impetus for the later, widespread repeal of such covenants.<ref name=LATObit/>
When the [[Arab–Israeli conflict#1967–73|1967 Arab-Israeli war]] broke, Cherif Guellal's term ended. He remained a representative of Algeria's national oil company [[Sonatrach]].<ref name=LATObit/>
Ambassador Guellal died of [[leukemia]] in Algeria on April 7, 2009. He was buried at the [[El Alia Cemetery]].<ref name=LATObit/>
==Personal life== Guellal had a long-term relationship with [[Yolande Fox]], who was [[Miss America]] in 1951 and later an [[opera]] singer. Guellal and Fox led an active social life, frequenting academic meetings and circulating among Washington's social and intellectual elite. His social secretary was [[Sally Quinn]]. Until his death, they raised Fox's grandchild, Yolande Paris Campbell, together.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newyorksocialdiary.com/across-the-nationacross-the-world/2016/washington-social-diary-the-last-of-the-georgetown-dames|title=Washington Social Diary: The Last of the Georgetown Dames|date=29 February 2016|publisher=}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://articles.latimes.com/2009/apr/13/local/me-cherif-guellal13 ''Los Angeles Times''] * [http://www.boston.com/bostonglobe/obituaries/articles/2009/04/13/cherif_guellal_76_algerian_resistance_fighter_diplomat/ Boston] * {{cite book|url=https://books.google.ca/books?id=7VUEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA26&dq=chérif+guellal&hl=fr&sa=X&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=chérif%20guellal&f=false|title=Life|date=July 21, 1967}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090801190642/http://cherifguellal.blog4ever.com/blog/index-308281.html Cherif Guellal]

{{Other uses|Dave Chalk}} {{Infobox person | name = David Chalk | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1963|9}} | birth_name = David Ian Chalk | birth_place = [[Croydon]], England {{flagicon|England}} | nationality = [[Canadians|Canadian]] | occupation = Entrepreneur, media personality | website = {{URL|www.askdavechalk.com}}
{{URL|http://chalk.today/}}}} '''David Ian Chalk''' (born 1963) is a Canadian technology entrepreneur and media personality who hosted the syndicated ''Dave Chalk's Computer Show'',[https://web.archive.org/web/20160304120353/http://www.locatetv.com/tv/dave-chalks-computer-show/1571820 "Dave Chalk's Computer Show," LocateTV website] and its subsequent incarnations ''Dave Chalk Computer Life'',[https://web.archive.org/web/20160304201100/http://www.locatetv.com/tv/dave-chalks-computer-life/1789067 "Dave Chalk's Computer Life", LocateTV website] ''Dave Chalk Connected Live'',[http://www.prweb.com/releases/2003/11/prweb89400.htm "Dave Chalk Returns to National Television with New 'Live and Interactive' Technology Show", PRWeb website] ''Dave Chalk Connected'',[http://www.globeinvestor.com/servlet/WireFeedRedirect?cf=GlobeInvestor/config&vg=BigAdVariableGenerator&date=20040922&archive=cnw&slug=1209222327 "Chalk Media Corp. CEO update Letter to Shareholders", The Globe and Mail website, Globe Investor section] and ''Dave Chalk Connected (In-flight)''.[http://www.adnews.com/19255 "TELUS to Sponsor Dave Chalk Connected", AdNews website] == Early life == Chalk was born in [[Croydon]], [[England]] on September 1963 and relocated with his family to [[British Columbia]], Canada. As a youth he suffered from [[Dyslexia]],{{cite web |url= http://www.thepowerofdyslexia.com/famous-dyslexics/ |title=Famous People With Dyslexia | Famous Dyslexics | |first= |last= |work=thepowerofdyslexia.com |year=2012 |accessdate=6 August 2012}} [[prosopagnosia|face blindness]] and other afflictions he acquired from brain damage at birth.[https://web.archive.org/web/20110826083452/http://rogerbjones.com/index.php?page=a-profile-of-david-chalk Interview with Roger B. Jones, June 7, 2010] == Education == Chalk completed high school, but did not finish his university degree. Chalk was granted an Honorary Doctorate of Technology by the [[University of the Fraser Valley]]’s Alumni Association board."[https://web.archive.org/web/20120323110630/http://www.ufv.ca/MarCom/newsroom/Chalk.htm "Honorary degree: David Chalk", University of Fraser Valley website, June 13, 2006.] == Career highlights == Chalk established the longest-running technology show in Canada ("Dave Chalk's Computer Show"),[https://web.archive.org/web/20120801165756/http://www.microsoft.com/business/smb/en-ca/smallbiz/products/customermanagement/articles/who_is_dave_chalk.mspx "Who is Dave Chalk?", by Dave Chalk, Microsoft SME Business Centre, date unknown] ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chalk, David}} [[Category:Canadian television hosts]] [[Category:Canadian radio personalities]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Croydon]] [[Category:Canadian businesspeople]] [[Category:BlackBerry Limited people]] [[Category:1963 births]] [[Category:People diagnosed with dyslexia]] [[Category:People with prosopagnosia]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2012}} {{Infobox person | name = | image = DimitriJChandris1.pdf | image_size = | caption = Portrait of Dimitri Chandris | birthname = Dimitri John Chandris | birth_date = 1921 | birth_place = [[Chios]], [[Greece]] | death_date = 1980 | death_place = [[London]], United Kingdom | resting_place = [[Kambos, Chios]], Greece | nationality = [[Greece|Greek]] | citizenship = [[Greece|Greek]] | occupation = {{flatlist| *Shipping tycoon *businessman}} | spouse = Myrto Pnevmaticou | children = John Chandris
Michael Chandris }} '''Dimitri John Chandris''' ({{lang-el|Δημήτρη Ιωάννη Χανδρή}}; born January 1921 - August 1980) was a Greek shipowner who established [[Chandris Line]], a large passenger shipping line, with his brother Anthony Chandris.{{cite book |last1=Theotokas |first1=Ioannis|last2= Harlaftis |first2=Gelina|date=2009 |title= Leadership in World Shipping: Greek Family Firms in International Business |url= https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=kGKHDAAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover&dq=inauthor:%22I.+Theotokas%22&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwj619uo15jZAhVIa1AKHU-TDgkQ6AEIKTAA#v=onepage&q&f=false|publisher= Palgrave Macmillan|page=126 |isbn= 0230233538}} Dimitri Chandris was the eldest son of [[John D. Chandris]], a prominent Greek shipowner.__FORCETOC__ == Early life == Dimitri Chandris was born in Chios to a wealthy family, son of Ioannis D. Chandris, a prominent ship-owner, and his wife Evgenia. In 1915, John Chandris had purchased his first ship, ''the S/S Dimitrios'', and founded Chandris.{{cite web |url=https://www.travelpulse.com/news/features/6-cruise-industry-pioneers.html |title=6 Cruise Industry Pioneers |author= |date=25 June 2014 |website=www.travelpulse.com |publisher=travAlliancemedia |access-date= 9 February 2018|quote=Although Anthony and Dimitri Chandris were responsible for developing Celebrity Cruises, their role in the industry was greatly influenced by the accomplishments of their father, John D. Chandris. }} Following the outbreak of [[World War II]], Dimitri Chandris relocated from [[Chios]] to London with his family, joining a large number of other ship-owning families from Greece.{{cite news|last1= Kakissis|first1= Joanna|title= Greek shipping families in the spotlight|url= https://www.ft.com/content/4ee112a6-ab30-11df-9e6b-00144feabdc0|accessdate=9 February 2018|work=Financial Times|date=21 August 2010}} All of his ships were requisitioned by the UK government to assist in the war effort. == Post War == At the end of the war, Dimitri set about reconstructing the family business almost from scratch. He had no alternative but to remain in the U.K. because, although the war might have ended in Europe, Greece became embroiled in a [[Greek Civil War|civil war]]. Greek shipowners, therefore, elected to operate in either of the then two great maritime centres of London and New York. In 1950, he was elected on to the Board of the Union of Greek Shipowners(UGS). He also served as Vice President of the UGS from 1960 to 1964. (His brother Anthony later served as President of the UGS). During the 1960s and 1970s, he was very active with various business interests in Greece including the establishment of the Alpha beer brewery (which became the second largest in Greece), a large motor franchise based on [[Rootes Motors|Rootes cars]] and a substantial hotel group. He was also involved in several charities including establishment of the ''School of Maritime Engineering'' in his home island of Chios. == Shipping Career == Prior to the outbreak of World War II, Chandris operated six vessels: the passenger ships ''Dimitrios'', ''Chimara'' and ''Corte II'', and the steamers ''Dimitrios II'', ''Vlassios'' and ''Eugenia''.{{cite book |last1=Miller |first1=William H.|date=1993 |title= The Chandris Liners |url= http://www.ssaustralishomepage.co.uk/chandris.html|publisher= Carmania Press|page=4 |isbn= 0951865625}} In the years following 1945, Dimitri and Anthony Chandris began to develop Chandris into the largest Greek passenger shipping firm. In 1945, Dimitri Chandris led the acquisition of [[Chandris Line|Charlton Steam Shipping Company Ltd.]], which operated a fleet of passenger vessels from headquarters in Newcastle. This purchase signalled the beginning of the Chandris Group’s concentrated expansion efforts around passenger travel. Recognising the urgent need to provide passenger ships for displaced peoples and refugees in post-War Europe, the Chandris Group purchased the ''Prince David'' and ''Prince Robert'' (pictured right) from the Canadian Royal Navy in 1945. Following rebuilding and conversion, the new vessels were leased by the Chandris Group to the [[International Refugee Organization|International Refugee Organisation]]. More intensive expansion efforts were undertaken from 1959, after which the Chandris Group acquired several large passenger ships, notably the ''[[MV Bloemfontein Castle|RMS Bloemfontein Castle]]'', the ''Bretagne'', and the ''[[SS Lurline]]'' (later renamed the Ellinis).{{Cite news|title=Smith's Dock Wins Greek Order for Liner Conversion|date=30 September 1963|work=The Financial Times|via=Gale NewsVault}} == Chandris Line == In 1950, Dimitri Chandris was elected on to the Board of the Union of Greek Shipowners (UGS), later serving as the organisation’s Vice President from 1960-1964. By the 1970s, the Chandris Group had developed multifarious activities moving into tankers and tramp ships as well as passenger and cruise ships. By 1976, Chandris had the largest passenger-cruise ship fleet in the world, surpassing the records held by major companies such as [[Cunard Line|Cunard]] and [[Union-Castle Line|Union-Castle]]. An editorial feature in Lloyd’s Review praised the recovery and renaissance of the Greek shipping sector, led by companies and individuals from Chios, writing: ''“It is not surprising, therefore, that a name often mentioned with Greek shipping – Chandris – was born in Chios. Nor is it surprising that the most successful passenger ship operator in modern times should be Chandris.”''{{cite magazine |author= |title=Lloyd's Review |url=https://books.google.co.uk/books/about/Lloyd_s_Review.html?id=ZjjyAAAAMAAJ&redir_esc=y|magazine= Lloyd's Review|location=London |publisher=Lloyd's of London Pres.|date=1976|access-date=9 February 2018 }} == Death == Having been resident in London since World War II, Dimitri Chandris returned permanently to Greece in July 1980 to work and focus on the hotel group he established. Shortly following his return to Greece, Dimitri was involved in a boating accident. He was transferred to [[The London Clinic]] for medical care but died following an operation. Dimitri was buried in the Chandris family chapel next to the church of Agios Vlasios in [[Chios|Kambos]], Chios. == Other Ventures == Outside of shipping, Dimitri Chandris was involved in a number of other business ventures, establishing a large automotive franchise, a brewery and a substantial hotel group. ==See also== {{Portal|Greece|Biography}} *[[Greek shipping]] *[[Chios]] *[[Celebrity Cruises]] *[[John D. Chandris]] == References and Sources == {{DEFAULTSORT:Chandris, Dimitri}} [[Category:1921 births]] [[Category:1980 deaths]] [[Category:Greek businesspeople]] [[Category:Greek businesspeople in shipping]] [[Category:People from Chios]]

The '''equity of redemption''' refers to the right of a mortgagor in [[law]] to redeem his or her property once the debt secured by the [[mortgage law|mortgage]] has been discharged.
==Overview== Historically, a mortgagor (the borrower) and a mortgagee (the lender) executed a conveyance of legal title to the property in favour of the mortgagee as security for the loan. If the loan was repaid, then the mortgagee would return the property; if the loan was not repaid, then the mortgagee would keep the property in satisfaction of the debt. The equity of redemption was the right to petition the [[Court of equity|courts of equity]] to compel the mortgagee to transfer the property back to the mortgagor once the secured obligation had been performed.<ref>See ''[[Santley v Wilde]]'' [1899] 2 Ch 474</ref> Today, most mortgages are granted by [[Security interest#Statutory mortgage|statutory charge]] rather than by a formal conveyance, although theoretically there is usually nothing to stop two parties from executing a mortgage in the more traditional manner.<ref>Some countries have limited the grant of traditional mortgages by statute in some circumstances. For example, in [[England and Wales]] a mortgage of land may only be made by way of statutory charge or demise for a term of years absolute (a lease), see sections 85-86 of the Law of Property Act 1925</ref>
Traditionally, the courts have been astute to ensure that the mortgagee did not introduce any artificial stipulations into the contractual arrangements to impede a mortgagor's ability to satisfy obligations and reclaim the property. Such impediments are "clogs" on the equity of redemption, and the courts of equity were particularly astute<ref>See {{cite bailii|litigants=[[Jones v Morgan]]|year=2001|court=EWCA|division=Civ|num=995}} at para 50.</ref> in striking down any provision which was, or in later cases, which may be, a clog.
Where [[collateral (finance)|collateral]] is pledged in [[prime brokerage]] transactions, it is common for the broker to rehypothecate the collateral. Concerns remained, however, that because the rehypothecation might theoretically mean that the lender could lose title to the collateral, and thereby possibly be unable to reconvey it to the primary customer, it was speculated that such rehypothecation is possibly unlawful.{{Citation needed|date=November 2012}}
The tide has for some years now turned against striking down every clause in a mortgage document that might conceivably impede the right to redeem.<ref>The tide began to turn in ''[[Biggs v Hoddinott]]'' [1898] 2 Ch 307, where it was held that, in a brewery mortgage case, a covenant to take beer from the mortgagee limited to the continuance of the security did not clog the equity of redemption, it being generally realised that an extreme response to perceived clogs undermined the commercial arrangements of the parties.</ref>
The equity of redemption is itself recognised as a separate species of property, and can be bought, sold or even itself mortgaged by the holder.
Historically the equity of redemption would naturally expire upon the mortgagor breaching the terms of repayment. However, in modern times, extinguishing the equity of redemption (and leaving the mortgagee with absolute title to the property) ordinarily requires a court order in most jurisdictions. For both legal and practical reasons, the use of [[foreclosure]] as a remedy has fallen into disuse.<ref>Foreclosure used to be a mortgagee’s primary remedy, but "it is now rarely sought or granted." see ''[[Palk v Mortgage Services Funding plc]]'' [1993] Ch 330 at 336</ref> Even where a mortgagee seeks an order for foreclosure from the courts, the courts will frequently order judicial sale of the property instead.
==See also== *''[[Vernon v Bethell]]'' (1762) 28 ER 838 *''[[Knightsbridge Estates Trust Ltd v Byrne]]'' [1940] AC 613 * [[Mortgage law]] * [[Security interest]]

{{more citations|date=August 2017}} In [[computer science]], '''event monitoring''' is the process of collecting, analyzing, and [[Signal (information theory)|signaling]] event occurrences to subscribers such as [[operating system]] [[Process (computing)|processes]], active [[database]] rules as well as human operators. These event occurrences may stem from arbitrary sources in both [[software]] or [[computer hardware|hardware]] such as operating systems, [[database management system]]s, [[application software]] and [[Microprocessor|processor]]s. Event monitoring may use a [[time series database]].
== Basic concepts == Event monitoring makes use of a [[computer bus|logical bus]] to transport event occurrences from [[communication source|source]]s to [[observation|subscriber]]s, where ''event sources'' signal event occurrences to all event subscribers and ''event subscribers'' receive event occurrences. An event bus can be distributed over a set of physical [[Node (networking)|node]]s such as standalone computer systems. Typical examples of event buses are found in [[graphical user interface|graphical systems]] such as [[X Window System]], [[Microsoft Windows]] as well as development tools such as SDT.
''Event collection'' is the process of collecting event occurrences in a filtered [[Data logging|event log]] for analysis. A ''filtered event log'' is logged event occurrences that can be of meaningful use in the future; this implies that event occurrences can be removed from the filtered event log if they are useless in the future. [[#Event log analysis|''Event log analysis'']] is the process of analyzing the filtered event log to aggregate event occurrences or to decide whether or not an event occurrence should be signalled. ''Event signalling'' is the process of signalling event occurrences over the event bus.
Something that is monitored is denoted the ''monitored object''; for example, an application, an operating system, a database, hardware etc. can be monitored objects. A monitored object must be properly conditioned with event [[sensor]]s to enable event monitoring, that is, an object must be instrumented with event sensors to be a monitored object. ''Event sensors'' are sensors that signal event occurrences whenever an event occurs. Whenever something is monitored, the [[probe effect]] must be managed.
==Monitored objects and the probe effect== As discussed by Gait,<ref>J. Gait (1985). A debugger for concurrent programs. ''Software-Practice And Experience'', 15(6)</ref> when an object is monitored, its behavior is changed. In particular, in any [[concurrent system]] in which processes can run in [[parallel computing|parallel]], this poses a particular problem. The reason is that whenever sensors are introduced in the system, processes may execute in a different order. This can cause a problem if, for example, we are trying to localize a [[fault (technology)|fault]], and by monitoring the system we change its behavior in such a way that the fault may not result in a failure; in essence, the fault can be masked by monitoring the system. The ''[[probe effect]]'' is the difference in behavior between a monitored object and its un-instrumented counterpart.
According to Schütz,<ref>W. Schütz (1994). Fundamental issues in testing distributed real-time systems. ''Real-Time Systems'', 7(2):129–157</ref> we can avoid, compensate for, or ignore the probe effect. In critical real-time system, in which timeliness (i.e., the ability of a system to meet time constraints such as deadlines) is significant, avoidance is the only option. If we, for example, instrument a system for testing and then remove the instrumentation before delivery, this invalidates the results of most testing based on the complete system. In less critical real-time system (e.g., media-based systems), compensation can be acceptable for, for example, [[Performance test (assessment)|performance testing]]. In non-concurrent systems, ignorance is acceptable, since the behavior with respect to the order of execution is left unchanged.
==Event log analysis== Event log analysis is known as event composition in [[active database]]s, chronicle recognition in [[artificial intelligence]] and as real-time logic evaluation in real-time systems. Essentially, event log analysis is used for [[pattern matching]], filtering of event occurrences, and aggregation of event occurrences into composite event occurrences. Commonly, [[dynamic programming]] strategies from [[algorithm]]s are employed to save results of previous analyses for future use, since, for example, the same pattern may be match with the same event occurrences in several consecutive analysis processing. In contrast to [[general rule processing]] (employed to assert new facts from other facts, cf. [[inference engine]]) that is usually based on [[backtracking]] techniques, event log analysis algorithms are commonly [[greedy algorithm|greedy]]; for example, when a composite is said to have occurred, this fact is never revoked as may be done in a backtracking based algorithm.
Several mechanisms have been proposed for event log analysis: [[finite state automata]], [[Petri nets]], [[procedural programming|procedural]] (either based on an imperative programming language or an object-oriented programming languages), a modification of [[Boyer–Moore string search algorithm]], and simple [[temporal network]]s.
==See also== * [[Event stream processing]] (ESP) * [[Complex event processing]] (CEP) * [[Network monitoring]] * [[Runtime verification]] (RV)
==References== <references />

{{Infobox officeholder |name = Fouad Ali El Himma <!-- {{small|عبد الإله بنكيران}} --> |office = |image = |monarch = |predecessor = |successor = | signature = |office2 = |predecessor2 = |successor2 = |party = [[Authenticity and Modernity Party]] |predecessor1 = |successor1 = |birth_date = 6 December 1962 |birth_place = [[Ben Guerir]], [[Morocco]] |death_date = |death_place = |religion = [[Sunni Islam]] |term_start = |alma_mater = [[Mohammad V University]] |education = |term_end = }} '''Fouad Ali El Himma''', (born 6 December 1962, in [[Ben Guerir]], Morocco) is an influential Moroccan politician and senior advisor for [[Mohammed VI of Morocco|Mohammed VI]] of whom he is said to be a very close friend. Since he became Secretary of State in the Ministry of the Interior in November 1999, he has played a prominent role in the Moroccan State. In 2008, he founded the [[Authenticity and Modernity Party]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.economist.com/node/13964243|title=The king’s friend|date=2009-07-02|newspaper=The Economist|issn=0013-0613|access-date=2016-10-08}}</ref> El Himma was a classmate of Mohammed VI at the [[Collège Royal (Rabat)|Collège Royale]] and was the director of his cabinet when he was crown prince.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.jeuneafrique.com/mag/333963/politique/fouad-ali-el-himma-lhomme-orchestre/|title=Fouad Ali El Himma : l'homme-orchestre de Mohammed VI - JeuneAfrique.com|date=2016-06-21|newspaper=JeuneAfrique.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2016-10-08}}</ref>
==Education== He earned a BSc of Law from Mohammad V University in Rabat in 1986. He earned a Post Graduate Diploma in Political Science in 1988 and a Post Graduate Diploma in Administrative Science in 1989. His training Period in the Ministry of the Interior (Morocco) was 1986-1990.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.moroccoworldnews.com/2011/12/18203/king-mohammed-vi-appoints-fouad-ali-el-himma-as-his-advisor/|title=King Mohammed VI Appoints Fouad Ali El Himma As His Advisor|last=News|first=Morocco World|date=2011-12-07|newspaper=Morocco World News|access-date=2016-10-08}}</ref>
==Business== According to media reports, El Himma owns the firm [[Mena media consulting]]<ref>{{cite news|title=El-Himma, le joker du roi|url=http://www.lepoint.fr/villes/el-himma-le-joker-du-roi-14-10-2010-1252455_27.php|accessdate=26 November 2013|newspaper=Le Point|date=14 October 2010|author=Mireille Duteil}}</ref> which held contracts with the Moroccan Ministry of the Interior.<ref name=tq>{{cite news|title=Telquel: Le Maroc tel qu'il est|url=http://www.telquel-online.com/archives/508/lessentiel_508.shtml|accessdate=26 November 2013|newspaper=Telquel N° 508|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203001242/http://www.telquel-online.com/archives/508/lessentiel_508.shtml|archivedate=3 December 2013|df=}}</ref> According to the press, the company conducts surveillance and intelligence gathering over [[social media]] platforms.<ref name=tq/>
==Brief history==
1992-1997: Elected President of the Municipal Council for [[Ben Guerir]] (Morocco).
1992-1997: Parliamentary Deputy for Rahamneh Constituency (Morocco).
1997: Named Head of the Court of the Crown Prince (Morocco).
1999-2000: Secretary of State in the Ministry of the Interior (Morocco).
2002: Minister Delegate to the Interior (Morocco).
August 2007: Quit the Ministry of Interior to participate in the parliament election of September 2007
2008: founded the [[Authenticity and Modernity Party]]
Since December 2011 : Counselor to His Majesty The King Mohammed VI of Morocco.
==See also== *[[Mounir Majidi]] *[[Yassine Mansouri]]

{{refimprove|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox television | show_name = Fox Business Morning | image = FOX Business Network - FOX Business Morning logo.jpg | caption = Original title card used from 2007-10-15 through 2008-07-11 | genre = [[Business]] [[News]] [[Television program|program]] | camera = [[Multi-camera]] | picture_format = [[480i]] (SDTV)
[[720p]] | runtime = 60 minutes | presenter = [[Jenna Lee]]
[[Connell McShane]] | country = United States | location = New York City | language = English | network = [[Fox Business Network]] | first_aired = October 15, 2007 | last_aired = May 7, 2010 | preceded_by = | website = http://www.foxbusiness.com/ }} '''''Fox Business Morning''''' was an early morning [[business]] [[newscast]] that aired on the [[Fox Business Network]] from 5-7am [[Eastern Time]]. Anchored by [[Jenna Lee]] and [[Connell McShane]], it was the first show to be aired on the [[Television network|network]] when it launched October 15, 2007. [[Nicole Petallides]] served as Jenna Lee's original co-anchor before she was replaced with McShane on May 12, 2008. Originally airing as a one-hour program, ''Fox Business Morning'' expanded to two hours on May 12, 2008. The second hour of this program replaced the first hour of ''[[Money for Breakfast]]'', which in turn, contracted to two hours. ''Fox Business Morning'' once again contracted to 1 hour on October 5, 2009 to make way for ''[[Imus in the Morning]].'' The show was canceled May 7, 2010 and was replaced by a ''Best of Imus in the Morning'' hour at 5am ET, an hour before the live Imus broadcast at 6am ET.http://insidecablenews.wordpress.com/2010/05/07/more-fbn-changes/ A similar early-morning business program, ''[[FBN:AM]]'' (co-anchored by Casone and [[Lauren Simonetti]]), debuted June 1, 2015 after ''Imus in the Morning'' ended its run on the network at the end of May of that year. ==Format== This early morning program began with a look at the overnight headlines, along with a review of the Asian stock markets and a look at ongoing trading on the European markets from [[Ashley Webster]], who is the network's London-based correspondent and overseas markets editor. In addition, this program also previewed the U.S. business day, including that day's corporate and economic diaries. ==Segments== Some of these segments included: *'''The Lead:''' A look at the business day's lead story, seen at the start of each half-hour. *'''Instant Audit:''' *'''World Market Report:''' A look at the overseas stock markets, including a review of the trading day in Asia (from [[Sky News Business Channel]]) and ongoing trading in Europe from Ashley Webster. *'''While You Were Sleeping:''' A look at the overnight business and general (non-business) news headlines. *'''Business Travelers' Forecast:''' A brief summary of the day's weather around the nation. *'''Fox Business Radar:''' The anchors look at the stocks that they were watching throughout the day. *'''The Number:''' [[Ray Hennessey]] joins the program with a number that statistically relates to the business day ahead. *'''The Agenda:''' A brief summary of the U.S. business day. *'''The Early Call:''' A look at the day's early market call for a certain stock and/or index. *'''C-Suite Sit-Down:''' This segment featured one of the program's anchors sitting down with a company executive. Moved from ''Money for Breakfast'' on 2008-05-12. *'''Fox Business Squawk Box:''' This segment features the program's anchors and Fox Business contributors debating the day's biggest stories in the business world. Moved from ''Money for Breakfast'' on 2008-05-12. ==Anchors== *Jenna Lee (2007-10-15 - 2010-5-07) *Connell McShane (2008-05-12 - 2010-5-07) *Nicole Petallides (2007-10-15 - 2008-05-09) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==See also== *''[[Worldwide Exchange]]'' (an early morning global business newscast airing on [[CNBC]] US 5-6am ET) *''[[Squawk Box]]'' (a morning business newscast airing on [[CNBC]] 6-9am ET) {{US morning news shows}} {{Fox Business Shows}} [[Category:Fox Business Network programs]] [[Category:2007 American television series debuts]] [[Category:2000s American television series]] [[Category:American television news programs]] [[Category:American television talk shows]] [[Category:Business-related television series]]

{{EngvarB|date=March 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=March 2015}} {{Chinese name|[[Yang (surname)|Yeoh (杨)]]}} {{multiple issues| {{notability|Biographies|date=December 2013}} {{advert|date=December 2013}} }} {{Infobox officeholder | honorific_prefix = [[Malay titles|Yang Berbahagia Tan Sri Dato']] (Dr) | name = Francis Yeoh Sock Ping | honorific-suffix = [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]], [[Order of Loyalty to the Crown of Malaysia|P.S.M.]], FICE | image = Francis_Yeoh.jpg | imagesize = | caption = Francis Yeoh is a prominent business personality in [[Malaysia]]. | order = | office = Executive Chairman of [[YTL Corporation]] | term_start = 1988 | term_end = | predecessor = | successor = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1954|08|23}} | birth_place = [[Kuala Selangor]], Malaysia | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = Malaysian | spouse = Late Puan Sri Datin Paduka Rosaline Yeoh | party = | relations = | children = 5 (including [[Ruth Yeoh|Ruth]] and [[Rebekah Yeoh|Rebekah]]) | alma_mater = Kingston University
University of Nottingham | occupation = | profession = Businessman | religion = Christian }} [[Malay titles|Tan Sri Dato']] (Dr) '''Francis Yeoh Sock Ping''', [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]], [[Order of Loyalty to the Crown of Malaysia|P.S.M.]], FICE (born 23 August 1954) is a Malaysian businessman, and the eldest son of Malaysia billionaire The Late Tan Sri Dato Seri Dr [[Yeoh Tiong Lay]]. He was appointed managing director of [[YTL Corporation]] in 1988, and grew YTL Group from a single listed entity in 1985 to five listed companies, one of the largest conglomerates in Malaysia.Francis Yeoh: “Entrepreneurship in Malaysia”, in: [[Frank-Jürgen Richter]] and Thang D. Nguyen (eds) ''The Malaysian Journey'', Marshall Cavendish 2004 ==Early life== Yeoh had his secondary school education at [[Victoria Institution]] in [[Kuala Lumpur]], Malaysia, where he was school captain. He obtained a bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering from Kingston Polytechnic (now [[Kingston University]], United Kingdom) in 1978. He was conferred an honorary doctorate from his [[alma mater]], [[Kingston University]] on February 2014. On July 2014 he received an honorary doctorate from the [[University of Nottingham]], England. He is a Fellow of the [[Institution of Civil Engineers]]. ==Career== He was appointed managing director of [[YTL Corporation]] in 1988 and grew it into a global infrastructure development conglomerate with a combined Market Capitalization of USD 7.8 billion and total assets of US18.2 billion as at 31 December 2017. Yeoh also serves as Executive Chairman of YTL Group and YTL Starhill Global REIT, Chairman of YTL PowerSeraya Private Limited, Chairman of [[Wessex Water]] Services Limited, and as an Independent Non-Executive Director of The Hong Kong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited [[HSBC]].{{cite web|url=http://www.bloomberglive.com/asean/speakers|title=2015 Speakers - Bloomberg ASEAN Summit|year=2015|publisher=Bloomberg Finance|accessdate=18 August 2016}} Yeoh serves on the Advisory Councils of [[INSEAD]], the [[London Business School]], and the [[Wharton School]]. He co-founded the [[Kuala Lumpur Performing Arts Centre]], is Regional Chairman of International Friends of the [[Louvre]] and works with the [[Nature Conservancy Council]]. He is one of "Asia's 25 Most Powerful and Influential Business Personalities" by ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'' and ''[[Business Week]].'' After his father’s death in 2017, there was some controversy about the leadership of YTL with no single family member having a majority stake in the company, even though Yeoh was widely thought to be the successor. Yeoh refused to comment on the process.{{Cite news|url=https://www.straitstimes.com/asia/se-asia/corporate-malaysia-grapples-with-leadership-succession-0|title=Corporate Malaysia grapples with leadership succession|last=hermes|date=2017-11-13|work=The Straits Times|access-date=2018-11-05|language=en}} However by May 2018 Yeoh had up to 5.26 billion shares in YTL representing a 48.97% stake in the company.{{Cite news|url=http://www.theedgemarkets.com/article/major-shareholder-yeoh-tiong-lay-sons-tightens-grip-ytl-corp|title=Yeoh family mops up YTL Corp shares|date=2018-05-28|work=The Edge Markets|access-date=2018-11-05}} Yeoh is a longtime supporter of the development of the Kuala Lumpur-Singapore high speed rail (HSR) for years. The project is a joint venture between YTL and Tabung Haji.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nst.com.my/business/2018/04/353934/ytl-corp-deeply-passionate-about-kl-singapore-hsr-francis-yeoh|title=YTL Corp is|date=2018-04-06|work=NST Online|access-date=2018-11-05|language=en}} ==Awards== In 2002, Yeoh was the first Malaysian winner of the EY Entrepreneur of the Year.{{Cite news|url=http://www.theedgemarkets.com/article/ey-entrepreneur-year-malaysia-2017-francis-yeoh-recounts-enriching-humbling-experience|title=EY Entrepreneur Of The Year Malaysia 2017: Francis Yeoh recounts an enriching, humbling experience|date=2017-06-23|work=The Edge Markets|access-date=2018-11-01}} In 2006, Yeoh was awarded the Commander of the Most Excellent [[Order of the British Empire]] (CBE) by Her Majesty Queen [[Elizabeth II]]. In 2010, he was made 'Primus Inter Pares Honouree' of the Oslo Business for Peace Award [[Business for Peace Foundation]]. Also in 2010, he received the Corporate Social Responsibility Award at the 2010 [[CNBC]] Asia Business Leaders Awards. In 2015, he was awarded the Lifetime Achievement Award for Leadership in Regulated Industries at the 7th World Chinese Economic Summit (WCES), held in London. In 2016, Tan Sri Francis was honored with the prestigious [[Muhammad Ali]] Celebrity Fight Night Award at The Celebrity Fight Night in Arizona for his philanthropic efforts. In 2017, he was awarded the Kuala Lumpur Mayor's Award for Outstanding Contribution for his services to the city at the Kuala Lumpur Mayor Tourism Awards. In 2018 , he was bestowed the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold Rays with Rosette by His Majesty the Emperor of Japan. On Nov 23rd 2018 Tan Sri Francis will be bestowed with the honour as Grande Officer of the Order of the Star of Italy. ===Honour of Malaysia=== * {{flagu|Malaysia}} : Commander of the [[Order of Loyalty to the Crown of Malaysia#Commander|Order of Loyalty to the Crown of Malaysia]] (P.S.M.) (1997){{cite web |url=http://www.istiadat.gov.my/index.php/component/semakanlantikanskp/|title=Semakan Penerima Darjah Kebesaran, Bintang dan Pingat}} ==Personal life== Yeoh is a devout Christian and has often attributed his success in business to [[Jesus]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.theedgemarkets.com/article/francis-yeoh-recounts-enriching-humbling-experience|title=Francis Yeoh recounts an enriching, humbling experience|date=2017-06-12|work=The Edge Markets|access-date=2018-11-01}} His successes and devotion has led to many Christians citing him as an inspiration.Interview with GoodTV - 打造神國企業 - 楊肅斌, {{YouTube|BDC4_inKkis}} Yeoh married Puan Sri Datin Paduka Rosaline Yeoh in 1982 until her death in 2007 and they have five children, including [[Ruth Yeoh]] and [[Rebekah Yeoh]]. His siblings reside in Malaysia and are fellow directors of YTL Corporation. He is the paternal uncle of [[Michelle Yeoh (socialite)|Michelle]] and [[Rachel Yeoh]]. In 2017, Yeoh donated RM 8 million to charity in honour of his father Tan Sri Yeoh Tiong Lay. {{Cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017/10/23/yeoh-family-donates-rm8mil-to-charity-contributions-made-in-honour-of-late-business-magnates-legacy/|title=Yeoh family donates RM8mil to charity - Nation {{!}} The Star Online|website=www.thestar.com.my|access-date=2018-11-08}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.ytl.com.my YTL Corporation] * [http://www.ytlcommunity.com/ttnews/talks_and_thoughts.asp Tan Sri Francis Yeoh's Talks and Thoughts] * [http://www.ytlcommunity.com YTL Community] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Yeoh, Francis}} [[Category:1954 births]] [[Category:Alumni of Kingston University]] [[Category:Malaysian Christians]] [[Category:Commanders of the Order of the British Empire]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Malaysian people of Chinese descent]] [[Category:Malaysian billionaires]] [[Category:Malaysian businesspeople]] [[Category:Malaysian people of Hokkien descent]] [[Category:Malaysian chairmen of corporations]] [[Category:Commanders of the Order of Loyalty to the Crown of Malaysia]] [[Category:Yeoh family]]

The '''Governmental Accounting Standards Board''' ('''GASB''') is the source of [[Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (United States)|generally accepted accounting principles]] (GAAP) used by state and local governments in the [[United States]]. As with most of the entities involved in creating GAAP in the United States, it is a private, non-governmental organization.
The GASB is subject to oversight by the [[Financial Accounting Foundation]] (FAF), which selects the members of the GASB and the [[Financial Accounting Standards Board]], and it funds both organizations.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.gasb.org/jsp/GASB/Page/GASBSectionPage&cid=1176156726930|title=Board Members|website=www.gasb.org|access-date=2016-04-07}}</ref>
Its mission is to establish and improve standards of state and local governmental accounting and financial reporting that will result in useful information for users of financial reports and guide and educate the public, including issuers, auditors, and users of those financial reports.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.gasb.org/jsp/GASB/Page/GASBLandingPage&cid=1175804799024|title = About Us|website = www.gasb.org|access-date = 2016-04-07}}</ref>
The GASB has issued [[Timeline of Governmental Accounting Standards - US#Governmental Accounting Standards Board|''Statements'', ''Interpretations'', ''Technical Bulletins'', and ''Concept Statements'']] defining GAAP for state and local governments since 1984. GAAP for the Federal government is defined by the [[Federal Accounting Standards Advisory Board]].
==See also== * [[List of GASB Statements]] ==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.gasb.org/ GASB Official Website] * [http://benefitslink.com/pr/detail.php?id=42852 GASB 45 for the Masses--Tips for Small Employers to Comply with GASB 45]

'''Gross Enrollment Ratio''' ('''GER''') or '''Gross Enrollment Index''' ('''GEI''') is a [[statistics|statistical measure]] used in the [[education]] sector, and formerly by the [[UN]] in its [[Education Index]], to determine the number of students enrolled in school at several different grade levels (like elementary, middle school and high school), and use it to show the ratio of the number of students who live in that country to those who qualify for the particular grade level. The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization(UNESCO), describes ‘Gross Enrolment Ratio’ as the total enrolment within a country ‘in a specific level of education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population in the official age group corresponding to this level of education.’<ref>Official UN definition for GER</ref>
The GER can be over 100% as it includes students who may be older or younger than the official age group. For instance, the GER includes students who are repeating a grade, those who enrolled late and are older than their classmates, or those who have advanced quickly and are younger than their classmates. This allows the total enrollment to exceed the population that corresponds to that level of education.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/114955-how-can-gross-school-enrollment-ratios-be-over-100|title=How can gross school enrollment ratios be over 100 percent? – World Bank Data Help Desk|website=datahelpdesk.worldbank.org|language=en|access-date=2018-01-30}}</ref>
== UN Human Development Index use==
A combined gross enrolment ratio (CGER), incorporating all three levels of education, was used to calculate the [[Human Development Index|Human Development Index (HDI)]], an annual [[measuring well-being|gauge of well-being]] for [[United Nations|UN]] [[United Nations member states|member states]], from 1990 to 2009. Amongst other measures used in the calculation, the CGER was given one-third weight in assessing the [[knowledge]] component, represented by gross enrolment, while the adult [[literacy]] rate was given two-thirds weight.<ref>http://hdr.undp.org/hdr2006/pdfs/report/Techinical_notes.pdf page 2</ref>
== References ==
{{Reflist}} http://www.unesco.org/new/en/education/ http://www.worldbank.org/depweb/english/beyond/global/glossary.html
{{Authority control}} [[Category:Educational administration]] [[Category:Human Development Index]]

{{no footnotes|date=September 2014}} '''Henrique de Araújo de Sommer''' ([[Lisbon]], 29 January 1886 — [[Cascais]], 28 March 1944) was one of Portugal's most important industrialists.
He was a member of a German aristocratic family living in [[Portugal]], since his grandfather Heinrich Baron von Sommer joined the armies of D. [[Pedro IV of Portugal]], married a Portuguese lady and started a company - Casa Sommer & Cia. dedicated to importing iron.
Henrique de Sommer, after commercial studies in England, was called at the age of 26 to manage his family businesses.
He started the production of Portland cement at the Maceira Liz factory in 1923, being still remembered for his social work, and the out of ordinary working conditions for the factory workers.
With the acquisition of the Companhia de Cimentos Tejo in 1935 he became Portugal's main cement producer.
He experimented with the Basset method of iron ingot, but met with little success, having set along with a project of expansion of his cement production to Mozambique the path that would later be followed by his nephew [[António Champalimaud]].
He had no children, and the division of his inheritance among his nephews and niece was sadly known as the Sommer Inheritance Case, the longest lawsuit in Portuguese history.
== References == * [http://www.museusousamartins.org/frm/mi4op2doc.html Industrialização em Alhandra] * [http://www.atic.pt/content/qs_cronologia.asp ATIC – Associação Técnica da Indústria de Cimento] * [http://www.jornaldeleiria.pt/files/_viver_1227_478f3c1027dbd.pdf As gentes do bairro social da Maceira-Liz] * http://www.aps.pt/cms/docs_prv/docs/DPR4926acf8dbbb7_1.pdf
== See also == * [[Casa Sommer]]
== Bibliography == * Isabel Canha e Filipe Fernandes, António Champalimaud construtor de Impérios, Lisboa, A esfera dos livros, 2011 ({{ISBN|978-989-626-310-2}})

'''Henry Bosch''' [[Officer of the Order of Australia|AO]] (born 20 January 1931) is an Australian businessman, [[CEO]], Chairman and Governance advocate. He has worked to increase standards of corporate governance, leading to his authorship of such reports as the 1991 Bosch Report: “Corporate Practices and Conduct”, The Workings of a Watchdog and The Director at Risk – Accountability in the Boardroom.
He studied at [[Sydney University|Sydney]] and [[Oxford University|Oxford]] Universities and at the Centre d’Etudes Industrielles in [[Geneva]]. He resided at Wesley College while studying at Sydney University. He spent his initial career in the manufacturing sector in the aluminum, steel, man-made fibres and plastics industries in [[Switzerland]], [[Canada]], the [[United Kingdom]] and [[Australia]].
He has held the following company directorships:
* Company Director of [[Lysaght (Australian company)|John Lysaght]] 1972, * Managing Director of Nylex Corporation 1980, * President of the Plastics Institute, * Chairman of the Chemicals and Plastics Industry Council. * Bosh committee in 1995.
He was appointed an [[Officer of the Order of Australia]] in 1991 for services to industry, commerce and government. He was awarded the John Story Medal by the [[Australian Institute of Management Education and Training]] in the same year.
He is currently Adjunct Professor in the School of Management at [[RMIT University]].<ref>http://www.rmit.edu.au/browse/About%20RMIT%2FContact%20Us%2FStaff%2F;ID=kgmv3qjb30tt1;STATUS=A {{dl|date=August 2018}}</ref>
==Bibliography== * (1986). ''Shareholder's Rights - {{ISBN|978-1-86350-348-8}}

{{Infobox politician | name = Ihor Yeremeyev | native_name = Ігор Єремеєв | native_name_lang = uk | image = Ihor Yeremeyev.jpg | imagesize = | caption = Yeremeyev in February 2014 |birth_name=Ihor Myronovych Yeremeyev | birth_date = {{Birth date|1968|4|3|df=yes}} | birth_place = Ostrozhets, [[Mlyniv Raion]], [[Rivne Oblast]], [[Ukrainian SSR]], Soviet Union | nationality = Ukrainian | death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|2015|08|12|1968|4|3}} | death_place =[[Zurich]], Switzerland | spouse = | party = [[People's Party (Ukraine)|Agrarian Party of Ukraine]] (2002–2005)
[[Independent Politician|Independent]] (2012–2015) | otherparty = [[People's Will (parliamentary group)|People's Will]] | children = | alma_mater = National University of Water Management, [[Rivne]] | website = | office1 = [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] | convocation1 = [[4th Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada|4th convocation]] | constituency1 = [[People's Party (Ukraine)|Agrarian Party of Ukraine]], Electoral district No.23 | term_start1 = May 14, 2002 | term_end1 = February 4, 2005 | convocation2 = [[7th Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada|7th convocation]] | constituency2 = [[Independent (politician)|Independent]], Electoral district No.23 | term_start2 = December 12, 2012 | term_end2 = November 27, 2014 | convocation3 = [[8th Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada|8th convocation]] | constituency3 = Independent, Electoral district No.23 | term_start3 = November 27, 2014 | term_end3 = August 12, 2015 }} '''Ihor Myronovych Yeremeyev''' ({{lang-uk|Ігор Миронович Єремеєв}}, 3 April 1968 – 12 August 2015) was a Ukrainian politician. He is a co-owner of a Ukrainian fuel station network [[WOG (gas stations)|WOG]]. ==Biography== He was born in 1968 at Ostrozhets in the [[Mlyniv Raion]] of [[Rivne Oblast]], in what was the [[Ukrainian SSR]] of the [[Soviet Union]].{{r|Rada-Bio}} In 2002, he was elected to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] after winning a [[single-member districts]] seat as a member of the [[People's Party (Ukraine)|Agrarian Party of Ukraine]] in [[Manevychi]].{{ru icon}}'''/(website has automatic [[Google Translate]] option)''' [http://file.liga.net/person/366-igor-eremeev.html Short bio], LIGA In December 2010, he ranked 41st on the [[Kyiv Post]]'s list of the richest people in Ukraine.{{r|KP101217}} In the [[2012 Ukrainian parliamentary election]] and [[2014 Ukrainian parliamentary election]], he was elected back into parliament as a [[non-partisan]] candidate again after winning the single-member districts seat of Manevychi. He is the founder and head of the parliamentary group [[People's Will (parliamentary group)|People's Will]] since its foundation on 27 Februzry 2014 (until 27 November 2014 this group was called ''Sovereign European Ukraine'').{{uk icon}} [http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2014/02/27/7016482/ In the Council, a new group of 37 MPs], [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] (27 Febrero 2014){{uk icon}} [http://tvi.ua/new/2014/02/27/yeremeyev_pozafrakciyni_sformuvaly_hrupu_soborna_yevropeyska_ukrayina Yeremeyev: independent group formed "Sovereign European Ukraine"], [[TVi (channel)]] (27 February 2014){{uk icon}} [http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2014/11/27/7045600/ In Parliament created a faction], [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] (27 November 2014){{r|Rada-Bio}} On 26 July 2015, he received a head injury during a [[horse-riding]] accident in [[Lutsk]], [[Ukraine]].[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/280732.html MP Yeremeyev who fell from horse taken to European hospital - press service], [[Interfax-Ukraine]](29 July 2015) He died on 12 August 2015 while in a coma in a hospital in [[Zurich]], [[Switzerland]] afterwards.[http://24tv.ua/ru/ukraina/smert_eremeeva_podtverdila_ego_zhena_reshajut_gde_pohoronjat_nardepa/n601935 Смерть Еремеева подтвердила его жена: решают, где похоронят нардепа][http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2015/08/13/7077703/ Прес-служба підтвердила смерть Єремеєва] == References == {{Reflist|refs= {{cite web |url= http://gapp.rada.gov.ua/mps/info/page/5509 |script-title=uk:Єремеєв Ігор Миронович|language= Ukrainian |trans-title=Ihor Myronovych Yeremeyev |publisher= [[Verkhovna Rada]] }} {{cite web |url= http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/41-richest-ihor-yeremeyev-42-93041.html |title= #41 Richest: Ihor Yeremeyev, 42 |publisher= [[Kyiv Post]] |date= 17 December 2010 }} {{cite news|url=http://www.nrcu.gov.ua/en/148/583500/ |title=CEC registers 357 newly elected deputies of 422 |publisher=[[National Radio Company of Ukraine]] |date=25 November 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141204164227/http://www.nrcu.gov.ua/en/148/583500/ |archivedate=4 December 2014 |df= }}

{{Infobox person |name = Jim Liautaud |image = James P. Liautaud with Son, Jimmy John's Owner Jimmy John Liautaud.jpg |image size= 250px |caption = James P. Liautaud with his son, Jimmy John's owner Jimmy John Liautaud. |birth_name = James P. Liautaud | birth_date = {{Birth date|1936|10|19}} | birth_place = Chicago | death_date = {{Death date and age|2015|10|23|1936|10|19}} | death_place = Family cabin in the North Woods of Wisconsin | nationality = American |occupation =Entrepreneur
Founder of The Liautaud Institute
Clinical Professor University of Illinois at Chicago |alma_mater = University of Illinois at Urbana/Champaign (BSIE), Chicago School of Professional Psychology (hPsy.D, Business Psychology) |website = {{URL|www.liautaudinstitute.com|}} }} [[File:Jimmy John's Owner Jimmy John Liautaud.jpg|thumb|right|250px|James P. Liautaud's son, Jimmy John Liautaud]] '''Jim Liautaud''' (October 19, 1936 – October 23, 2015) was an [[industrialist]], [[inventor]] and [[business theorist]]. He is the father of [[Jimmy John's]] founder [[Jimmy John Liautaud]]. Liautaud provided his son with the seed money to start his restaurant business in 1983.{{cite web|last1=Gathman|first1=Dave|title=Elgin-area industrialist James Liautaud lived a fast life — in many ways|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/suburbs/elgin-courier-news/news/ct-ecn-elgin-liautaud-st-1106-20151113-story.html|website=The Courier-News|publisher=The Chicago Tribune|accessdate=9 June 2016|date=14 November 2015}} ==Early life and education== Liautaud grew up in [[Chicago]]{{cite web|last1=ESSICK|first1=KRISTI|title=Profiles in Later Life|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052748703298004574457472455337390|publisher=Wall Street Journal|accessdate=9 June 2016|date=17 October 2009}} and served in the [[US army]] in [[Korea]]. He received a Bachelor of Science degree in 1963{{cite web|title=Distinguished Alumni Awards|url=http://engineering.illinois.edu/engage/distinguished-alumni-and-friends/distinguished/article/5726|website=Engineering.illinois.edu|accessdate=9 June 2016|date=31 December 2005}} in [[mechanical engineering]] from the [[University of Illinois]], at [[Urbana-Champaign]].{{cite web|last1=Rohr|first1=Lauren|title=Jimmy John's founder recalls dad's zest for life|url=http://www.dailyherald.com/article/20151102/business/151109802/|publisher=Daily Herald|accessdate=9 June 2016|date=2 November 2015}} ==Career== ===Business=== He began his business career as a [[door-to-door salesman]] selling books for the [[Grolier Encyclopedia]] company. He founded a company while still in college; negotiating with [[Time Life]] to sell their magazines on campus, and ended up hiring 150 salespeople. During the late 1960s Liautaud became a pioneer of a new technology called composite molding. He became the president and co-owner of the Capsonic Group in 1968, which manufactured plastics and electronics in Elgin, Illinois. Being African American, Liautaud was one of the top minority executives in Chicago at the time.{{cite web |url= http://www.chicagobusiness.com/article/20151031/BLOGS03/151039965/father-of-jimmy-johns-owner-dies-helped-found-business |title=Father of Jimmy John's owner dies, helped found business}} He launched other companies in [[Elgin, Illinois|Elgin]] over the years, including American Antenna Company, which made the equipment for the citizens’ band radio industry, and K40 Electronics, which built a [[radar detector]] designed to allow drivers to detect when their speed was being monitored by police. With the money that Liautaud gave his son to start his own business, James John Liautaud (Jimmy John) was able to begin Jimmy John’s sandwich stores. He is the founder of Gabriel, Inc. He also was the founding Investor in two [[insurance companies]], Raffles and National Interstate;{{citation needed|date=June 2016}} and [[Blue Rhino]],{{cite web|title=THE SECURITIES ACT OF 1933 BLUE RHINO CORPORATION|url=http://www.nasdaq.com/markets/ipos/filing.ashx?filingid=612780|publisher=Securities and Exchange Commission|accessdate=9 June 2016|date=10 March 1998}} a [[gas distribution]] company. The latter two are now [[public companies]]. In all, Liautaud started and ran five companies before reaching his mid-50s. When he reached age 55, Liautaud had an “epiphany,” and took a two-year sabbatical after selling off his companies. He toured the US by motorcycle, read books on history, psychology and sociology. By the end of that break, he decided what his next step was, to become an academic to research the impact that psychology and social interactions have on the success of chief executives. ===Inventing=== In 1970 he received a patent for a molding process that he developed for [[General Instrument]]s. In 1974 he invented and manufactured the coin counter, which was used on all Western Electric single-coin pay phones. He was one of the early pioneers of ISO processes used in manufacturing the first [[air-bag]] sensors.{{cite web|title=The freshman class of '93.: CAPSONIC GROUP INC.|url=http://www.thefreelibrary.com/The+freshman+class+of+'93.-a013812824|publisher=The Free Library|accessdate=9 June 2016|date=1 June 1993}} During this time period Liautaud received between 60 and 80 US patents as well as many design awards.{{cite web|title=Patents by Inventor James P. Liautaud|url=http://patents.justia.com/inventor/james-p-liautaud|publisher=Justia Patents|accessdate=9 June 2016}} ===Academic career=== After Liautaud sold his businesses, and after a two-year hiatus, he joined the faculty of the University of Illinois at Chicago. He created and funded the [[Liautaud Graduate School of Business]] at the University of Illinois-Chicago. He developed a training methodology called PdEI, which helps chief executives implement the principles of positive psychology in the work place. ===Organizations=== He launched several organizations, including the Liautaud Institute, now known as the [[EI Leadership Institute]]. He also founded and funded the [[Liautaud Graduate School of Business]]. He founded two organizations serving CEO's; Young President Organizations (YPO) WindyCity Chapter{{cite web|title=About YPO-WPO The premier global leadership network|url=http://ypochicago.org/page-80563|publisher=YPO Chicago Chapter|accessdate=9 June 2016}} and the Chicago Family Business Council.{{cite web|title=WHY CFBC|url=http://www.chicagofbc.com/why-cfbc/|publisher=Chicago Family Business Council|accessdate=9 June 2016}} ===The EI Leadership Institute=== The EI Leadership Institute, (founded as the Liautaud Institute) was funded by Liautaud as a "use-inspired" research institute dedicated to researching and engineering proven solutions, leveraging people's [[biogenetic]] needs to create a happier, more effective workforce. At the Institute he engineered processes and proven learnable habits that are steeped in effective research, and use a methodical approach inspired from manufacturing practices (ISO) to create consistent, repeatable and viral change.{{cite web|title=A Use-inspired, Positive Change, Research Institute|url=http://www.liautaudinstitute.com/|publisher=The Liautaud Institute|accessdate=9 June 2016}} The EI Leadership Institute has been ranked as one of the top 40 Executive Education classes along with [[Northwestern University|Northwestern]] (Kellogg), [[MIT]] (Sloan), [[Columbia University|Columbia]] (Business School) and others.{{cite web|title=2013 Leading Executive Education Programs|url=http://chiefexecutive.net/2013-leading-executive-education-programs/|website=Chief Executive|accessdate=9 June 2016|date=1 October 2013}} ==Recreation== Liautaud participated in the creation of the Cannonball Run car race. In 1986, what had previously been an informal 400-mile race of high-performance cars became the legal Cannonball Run. ==Death== Liautaud died of [[pancreatic cancer]] on October 23, 2015, at the age of 79, at the family cabin in the North Woods of Wisconsin. ==Personal life== While attending the University of Illinois Liautaud met his wife ‘Gina’ Gudaityte Liautaud, to whom he was married for 54 years. Liautaud had four children, Greg, [[Jimmy John Liautaud|Jimmy John]], Robby and Lara. ==References== {{Reflist|3}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Liautaud, James P.}} [[Category:1936 births]] [[Category:2015 deaths]] [[Category:American business theorists]] [[Category:University of Chicago faculty]] [[Category:University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign alumni]] [[Category:University of Illinois at Chicago faculty]] [[Category:American army personnel of the Korean War]] [[Category:20th-century American businesspeople]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Chicago]] [[Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer]] [[Category:Deaths from cancer in Wisconsin]] [[Category:People from Elgin, Illinois]]

The '''Jarratt report''' was an inquiry into British [[higher education]] published in 1985.<ref>{{Cite news | url = https://www.theguardian.com/education/2005/mar/22/universityfunding.highereducation | title = Facing up to HE's new economy | date = 2005-05-22 | work = [[The Guardian]] | accessdate = 2009-08-29 | location=London | first=Howard | last=Newby}}</ref> While delivered during the [[Thatcher era]], it was commissioned by the [[Committee of Vice-Chancellors and Principals]]. The report viewed Universities as enterprises not unlike a factory, and in which students were the customer.{{Fact|date=July 2009}} Concomitantly, academics were viewed less as a self-governing group seeking to expand knowledge and more as shop-floor deliverers of education, subject to performance indicators. Organizational-functions, similarly, were viewed as need dedicated managers, with transfer of these roles from academics to these managers. The adoption of the report led to the abolition of academic tenure.{{Fact|date=July 2009}} It has been argued that the report thus laid the ground for the increase of managerialism in the academy.<ref name="Alderman2009"> [[Geoffrey Alderman]], ''[[Times Higher Education]]'', 30 July 2009. [http://www.timeshighereducation.co.uk/story.asp?storycode=407560 ''Higher Education in the United Kingdom since 1945: Simplistic view of insider betrayal''].</ref> It has also been stated that since the report, it has become explicit State policy that university staff are paid to help their employers compete against sister institutions, rather than to serve wider ends.<ref name="Sampson2006">{{cite journal |doi=10.1087/095315106777877502 |title=The death of learned journals |year=2006 |journal=Learned Publishing |volume=19 |issue=3 |pages=234|last1=Sampson |first1=Geoffrey }}</ref>
